concise_definition: adj. 专业的, 职业的; n. 专业人士

definitions.explanation_en: Relating to or characteristic of a profession or occupation, especially one that requires specialized training, skill, or knowledge; showing a high standard of competence and seriousness in one's work.
definitions.explanation_cn: 与职业或专业相关，尤其指需要专门训练、技能或知识的工作；表现出高水平的专业能力和严肃认真的工作态度。
definitions.example_en: She gave a professional presentation that impressed all the clients.
definitions.example_cn: 她做了一场专业的演示，给所有客户都留下了深刻印象。

definitions.explanation_en: Conducted with the standards, ethics, and discipline expected in a particular field, as opposed to amateur or casual behavior.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以某一领域所期望的标准、道德和纪律来执行，区别于业余或随意的行为。
definitions.example_en: The team maintained professional conduct even under intense pressure.
definitions.example_cn: 即使在巨大压力下，团队仍保持了专业的行为举止。

definitions.explanation_en: A person who engages in a specified activity as their main paid occupation, rather than as a pastime or hobby; someone with formal training and expertise in a particular field.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将某一特定活动作为主要有偿职业而非消遣或爱好而从事的人；在某一领域接受过正规训练并具备专业知识的人。
definitions.example_en: He is a professional athlete who has competed in three Olympic Games.
definitions.example_cn: 他是一名职业运动员，曾参加过三届奥运会。

comparison.analysis: “Expert” (专家) 强调在某一领域拥有深厚的知识、技能或经验，通常指技术层面的权威性。而 “professional” 更侧重于职业身份、行为规范和工作态度，即使一个人不是专家，只要以职业标准行事，也可称为 professional。
“Amateur” (业余者) 是 “professional” 的直接反义词，指非以职业为目的、缺乏系统训练或标准的人。专业性不仅体现在技能上，更体现在责任感、纪律性和一致性上，而业余者往往缺乏这些特质。
“Occupational” (职业的) 是一个更宽泛的形容词，仅指与某种职业相关，不必然包含专业水准或道德标准。例如 “occupational hazard”（职业危害）仅说明与工作有关，但不评价其专业性。而 “professional” 隐含了对质量、规范和伦理的追求。
